So back to the topic, why can't I make partitions AFTER installing ubuntu?
Including swap partition?
why not create partitions during install?
allow the system to execute the code within the file
but what does "(+x)" mean?
And this is done in properties, permissions, right?
nope, this is done on the commandline
So what is the make executable in properties > permissions about then? Is that something separate?
i believe that is the same.
So what is the command way to make a file executable?
going through the gui as you just described does the same. On the commandline you type chmod +x file
yes, just give it the full path of the file
like chomd +x full/path/to/the/file
